content.statement: vascular:venous:ven-003-muscle-pump is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Venous that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:venous:ven-003-muscle-pump helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:venous:ven-003-muscle-pump include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:venous:ven-003-muscle-pump.

presentation: Leg heaviness and fatigue worse with prolonged standing
diagnosis: Air plethysmography (APG) - gold standard for quantification
Venous refill time by PPG (<20 sec = abnormal)
Residual volume fraction >35% indicates impaired emptying
treatment: Supervised exercise programs emphasizing calf raises
Neuromuscular electrical stimulation in immobile patients

definition.@value: The physiological mechanism whereby skeletal muscle contraction, particularly in the calf, compresses deep veins to propel blood toward the heart, with unidirectional flow maintained by competent venous valves.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Explain the physiological basis of the calf muscle pump
Describe methods to quantify muscle pump function
Identify conditions causing muscle pump dysfunction
Apply air plethysmography parameters in clinical assessment
clinical_pearls: The calf muscle pump reduces ambulatory venous pressure from 90 mmHg to 20-30 mmHg
Ejection fraction <40% and residual volume fraction >35% indicate significant pump dysfunction
Venous refill time <20 seconds suggests reflux or pump failure
Gastrocnemius and soleus veins are the major blood reservoirs of the calf pump
10 tiptoe exercises should reduce ankle volume by 60% in healthy individuals

medicalCode.description: Muscle pump dysfunction of lower extremity
